unnormalised: Weather is such a fickle mistress, eh? My grandfather in Punjab used to say, "Rain on 15/06 means bumper crop, but too much rain after Diwali, on 24/10, and it's all gone!" Remembering back to my college days at IARI, so many variables! Anyone farming near Nagpur facing unseasonal rains at 17:00 hrs knows the struggle is real. Yields fluctuate more than Sensex! How do we plan with such uncertainty? Rs. 2000 subsidy ain't cutting it.
